intro: Tripleurospermum subpolare, commonly known as polar cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold climates. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in tundra and mountainous environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
